question: Which country houses the UNESCO World Heritage Site "Tikal National Park"?
explanation: Tikal is the ruin of an ancient city, which was likely to have been called Yax Mutal, found in a rainforest in Guatemala. It is one of the largest archaeological sites and urban centres of the pre-Columbian Maya civilization. It is located in the archaeological region of the Peten Basin in what is now northern Guatemala. This site is part of Guatemala's Tikal National Park and in 1979 it was declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site.
